questions.questionText: Explain recursion and provide an example problem that is best solved using recursion.
questions.correctAnswer: Recursion is a programming technique where a function calls itself to solve smaller instances of the same problem. A classic example is calculating factorial or solving the Tower of Hanoi.
questions.explanation: Recursive solutions simplify code for problems that can be broken down into similar subproblems, e.g., traversing tree structures or permutations generation.
questions.codeExample: fun factorial(n: Int): Int = if (n == 0) 1 else n * factorial(n-1)
